title: "What is the history and significance of provoked somnambulism in the field of medicine?"
first_phrase: This section explores the rise of the practice of provoked somnambulism and how it has attracted the attention of many physicians and scientists in the 19th century. The author talks about the success of Dr. Liébeault, who was previously rejected by his colleagues, and how his peers like Drs. Bernheim, Beaunis, Dumont, Liégeois, and Focachon have started to explore the practice of provoked somnambulism. The text also highlights the animosity towards this practice as it was associated with charlatans, and its proponents had to fight against skepticism and indifference.
